description: Possibly from Latin vim, accusative singular of vīs (“force, power, strength; (New Latin) energy, force”) (ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *weyh₁- (“to chase, pursue”); compare English vis); but perhaps a modern expressive formation.

entries.meaning: Ready vitality and vigour. [from mid 19th c.]
examples: Synonyms: energy, go, pep, pizzazz, verve, zest
